meanings.definition: The state or condition of being sore.
meanings.sent1: After the long hike, his sorenesses were evident in his tired muscles.
meanings.sent2: She winced at the sorenesses in her back after lifting heavy boxes all day.
meanings.sent3: The sorenesses in his legs made him walk like a penguin, much to his friends' amusement.
meanings.sent4: The sorenesses in her heart from the breakup felt like a weight she couldn't shake off.
meanings.sent5: The sorenesses in his body screamed at him to rest and recover.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being painful or sensitive to the touch.
meanings.sent1: The sorenesses in her bruised arm made even a gentle touch unbearable.
meanings.sent2: He winced at the sorenesses in his gums after the dental procedure.
meanings.sent3: The sorenesses in his sunburnt skin turned even a light breeze into a painful experience.
meanings.sent4: The sorenesses in her injured knee were a constant reminder of the accident.
meanings.sent5: The sorenesses in his shoulder made him regret the heavy lifting he did yesterday.

meanings.definition: The feeling of discomfort or pain in a specific area of the body.
meanings.sent1: She massaged her sorenesses in the hope of finding relief from the pain.
meanings.sent2: The sorenesses in his neck made it hard for him to turn his head.
meanings.sent3: The sorenesses in her feet after wearing high heels all night were a cruel punishment.
meanings.sent4: The sorenesses in his lower back were a constant reminder of his poor posture.
meanings.sent5: The sorenesses in her muscles were a sign that she had pushed herself too hard during the workout.
